educations.degree: Master of Science in Human Resource Management

headline: HR/Property Administrative Professional
summary: DHS / ICE / ERO Mission Support Specialist - Property/Human Resource Program Manager and Military Veteran with a Secret Security Clearance and 18+ years of proven experience in the Department of Defense and Department of Homeland Security.  Consistently improved inherited programs through strategic planning, training, and effective program implementation which resulted in being recognized for managing outstanding career programs.  Possess a comprehensive background in office management, career counseling, and staffing derived from extensive experience in 7 administrative offices.  Recipient of multiple awards for outstanding performance and professionalism.  Career supported by a BSBA in Human Resources/Organizational Management.

positions.companyName: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) / Operations Warfighter (OWF)
positions.title: Mission Support Internship - Human Resources / Property Management

positions.description:
UNITED STATES NAVYâ Various Locations                                            
Navy Career Counselor Manager
-Led, mentored, and trained 46 Career Counselors in supporting Sailors career goals as well as coordinating inspections, tracking program metrics, generating monthly and quarterly reports, and distributing training agenda.
-Served as Career Information Program Manager and subject matter expert for 18 military commands comprised of over 1,800 personnel for all career related programs and policies.
-Provided inbound executive leadership with current career program metrics within their areas, to include manning, retention, attrition, and recent quarterly and annual inspection reports

Navy Counselor, Command Career Counselor
-Developed company policies for attrition reduction, managed command career development programs, coordinated special Navy career information events, and conducted career development training.
-Provided counseling on career-related programs, scheduled and conducted career development boards, and provided exemplary customer service to 300+ Sailors.
-Processed, tracked, and retained 30 career correspondence documents monthly to include personnel action request, special program screenings, and reenlistment requests.
-Coordinated a monthly onboarding event that provided inbound personnel an introduction and summary of command programs and coordinators.
-Provided monthly training on new programs, policy changes, and a review of current program and 
instructions to 16 department career counselors monthly.
-Transitioned approximately 24 Sailors annually separating or retiring from the military by supporting them in identifying education and employment goals and providing resources available to assist in achieving those goals.
-Screened an average of 12 applicants a year for special programs including military officer candidates, special recruiting duty, as well as, overseas positions, leading to optimally qualified candidate selection.
positions.title: Navy Career Counselor / Human Resource Manager
